marketNews.title: TPMA Forms New JV, Potential Net Profit Addition up to +15%
marketNews.content: Trans Power Marine (TPMA) announced a cooperation with PT Samudra Investama Maju to establish a joint venture named PT Trans Ocean Permata (TOP) which will engage in coal transportation and logistics services in the South Sumatra region. TPMA explained that TOP has initial capital of 20 billion rupiah, with the company's ownership reaching 51%. In the next 2-3 years, TOP plans to acquire 20 sets of tugboats and barges and 2 floating crane units with a capex of 90 million US dollars. This expansion will be financed by 20% from internal cash, while the remainder will come from bank debt. This is not the first time TPMA has expanded through a joint venture. Previously, in 2021, the company formed a joint venture named PT Trans Logistik Perkasa (TLP) with T&J Industrial Holding Limited (TJI) - a business entity of Tsingshan Holding Group - and Pacific Pelayaran Indonesia. TLP itself was formed to transport Tsingshan's nickel products in Maluku. The company already owns 41 sets of tugboats and barges as of 1H24, with the fleet size targeted to reach 60 sets of tugboats and barges in 2025. Key Takeaway: The formation of this joint venture has the potential to become a growth catalyst for TPMA's financial performance going forward. Based on our conservative estimation, TOP has the potential to book revenue of 4.9-10.9 million US dollars in its first year of operation, equivalent to 5.4-12.1% of our FY24F estimate for TPMA's revenue post-consolidation with PT Bahtera Energi Samudra Tuah (BEST). We also estimate TOP's net profit in the first year of operation to reach 752.6 thousand - 1.7 million US dollars, equivalent to 2.7-6% of our FY24F estimate for TPMA's net profit. Some assumptions we used are: The addition of 20 sets of tugboats and barges and 2 floating crane units is carried out within a 3-year period. Assumption of revenue per fleet of 1.1 billion rupiah per month for tugboats and barges, equivalent to TLP which has the lowest revenue per fleet compared to TPMA and BEST, based on our calculation. Assumption of revenue per fleet of 7 billion rupiah per month for floating cranes, equivalent to the revenue per floating crane fleet of TPMA. Assumption of a net profit margin of 30% and reducing non-controlling interest by 49%. If TOP completes all its fleet acquisitions, we estimate TPMA's revenue and net profit can increase by 26.8 million US dollars and 4.1 million US dollars, respectively, equivalent to 29.5% and 14.7% of our FY24F revenue and net profit estimate for TPMA.

marketNews.title: GMFI Rights Issue to Obtain Rp418 M Assets from GIAA
marketNews.content: Garuda Maintenance Facility Aero Asia (GMFI) plans to hold a rights issue of up to 11.7 billion new shares with a dilution effect of up to 29.36%. The ratio and exercise price have not yet been announced, while the funds to be obtained are allocated for working capital. GMFI's controller, Garuda Indonesia (GIAA), will exercise all its rights through inbreng by transferring assets worth a total of 418.3 billion rupiah, consisting of 3 hangar units and their annexes along with supporting facilities at Soekarno-Hatta Airport. This plan will be discussed at the Extraordinary General Shareholders Meeting (RUPSLB) on October 16, 2024.

marketNews.title: MIDI Same Store Sales Growth and New Store Expansion
marketNews.content: Midi Utama Indonesia recorded same store sales growth (SSSG) of +12.01% YoY in August 2024 (vs. 1H24: +9.64% YoY), exceeding management's 2024 guidance of +8% YoY. MIDI management itself targets SSSG in 3Q24 around +11% YoY. MIDI also reported that the company has opened 36 new Alfamidi outlets in July-August 2024, so the total new outlets in 8M24 reached 111 units or equivalent to 55.5% of the 2024 target of 200 new outlets.

marketNews.title: DSSA Subsidiary Reportedly Wins Geothermal Working Area Auctions
marketNews.content: Bisnis reported that Dian Swastatika Sentosa's subsidiary in the geothermal sector, PT Daya Anugerah Sejati Utama, has won auctions for 2 geothermal working areas, namely in Cisolok Cisukarame, West Java and Nage, East Nusa Tenggara. Both working areas plan to build geothermal power plants (PLTP) of 40 MW each. However, Bisnis reported that the Ministry of ESDM has not yet been able to announce the auction winners, while DSSA declined to comment on this news.

marketNews.title: WIKA Repays Maturing Bonds and Sukuk of Rp896 Billion
marketNews.content: Wijaya Karya (WIKA) announced that the company has made principal payments for due obligations on its Ongoing Public Offering (PUB) II Phase I Bonds and Sukuk amounting to 896 billion rupiah. The President Director of Wijaya Karya, Agung Budi Waskito, stated that this payment is in accordance with the agreement between the company and the bondholders and sukuk holders in the trusteeship. In addition to repaying the principal due, WIKA also paid the interest on the PUB II Phase I Bonds and Sukuk amounting to 55.06 billion rupiah.

marketNews.title: PORT New Controller Announces Mandatory Tender Offer
marketNews.content: The new controller of Nusantara Pelabuhan Handal, China Merchants International Port-Integrated Development (Hong Kong) Company Limited, announced a mandatory tender offer plan for approximately 726 million (25.8%) PORT shares at a price of 818 rupiah per share from September 3 to October 2, 2024. This price is -15.2% lower than PORT's closing price as of Tuesday (10/9). This corporate action was carried out after China Merchants International Port-Integrated Development (Hong Kong) Company Limited acquired 51% of PORT shares in June 2024.

marketNews.title: PT Arthakencana Rayatama Increases Stake in AKRA
marketNews.content: The controller of AKR Corporindo, PT Arthakencana Rayatama, purchased 32.1 million AKRA shares at an average price of 1,433.9 rupiah per share on September 4-6, 2024. The total transaction value reached 46 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, PT Arthakencana Rayatama's ownership in AKRA increased from 62.89% to 63.05%.

marketNews.title: BCAP Denies Acquisition Offer for Vista Outdoor (NYSE: VSTO)
marketNews.content: MNC Kapital Indonesia (BCAP) denied reports from several national media stating that the company had submitted an offer to acquire Vista Outdoor (NYSE: VSTO). BCAP explained that the acquisition offer was made by MNC Capital Partners, L.P., a company based in Montreal, Canada, and is not part of and/or affiliated with the MNC Group.

marketNews.title: OJK Survey: Banking Liquidity Risk Stable and Expected to Improve in 3Q24
marketNews.content: The 3Q24 banking business orientation survey conducted by OJK indicated that liquidity risk remains manageable and is expected to improve compared to the previous quarter, driven by the expectation that banks' liquid assets will grow. Previously, OJK noted that banking liquidity began to tighten with the Loan-to-Deposit Ratio (LDR) reaching 86.51% as of July 2024, marking the highest level since August 2020.

marketNews.title: Government Targets Flight Ticket Prices to Drop -10% by October 2024
marketNews.content: The Minister of Transportation, Budi Karya Sumadi, stated that the government targets air ticket prices to drop by -10% by October 2024. Budi mentioned that this fare reduction can be achieved if his two proposals—namely tax relief for spare parts and de-monopolization of jet fuel supply—can be executed in the near future.

marketNews.title: DPR Legislation Body Removes Limit on the Number of Ministries in State Ministry Bill
marketNews.content: The Deputy of the DPR Legislation Body, Achmad Baidowi, stated that the State Ministry Bill will eliminate the limit on the number of ministries. Furthermore, the Bill also contains changes related to the division or merger of agencies within the ministries, so that the president can later regulate the needs of these agencies. Baidowi said that the majority of political party factions in the DPR Legislation Body have agreed to these changes and the State Ministry Bill will soon be brought to the DPR plenary meeting.

marketNews.title: Criteria for Subsidized Fuel Users to be Finalized This Week, Leakage Information on Engine Capacity Limits
marketNews.content: CNBC Indonesia reported that the subsidized fuel restriction regulation currently being prepared by the government will prohibit gasoline cars with engine capacities above 1,400 cc from using Pertalite. Additionally, CNBC Indonesia also reported that the regulation will prohibit diesel cars with engine capacities above 2,000 cc from using subsidized diesel. The criteria for subsidized fuel using vehicles will be regulated in the ESDM Ministerial Regulation, although the official details have not yet been announced. The subsidized fuel restriction is targeted to come into effect starting October 1, 2024.

marketNews.title: US Consumer Borrowing Rose Significantly in July 2024
marketNews.content: The US central bank, The Fed, noted that US consumer credit increased by 25.45 billion US dollars in July 2024 (vs. June 2024: an increase of 5.23 billion US dollars), exceeding consensus expectations which predicted an increase of 12.5 billion US dollars and marking the highest increase since November 2022.

marketNews.title: Resource Alam Indonesia (KKGI) Director Sold Shares
marketNews.content: The Director of Resource Alam Indonesia (KKGI), Wimpi Salim, sold 869,099 KKGI shares at an average price of 590 rupiah per share on September 6, 2024. The total transaction value reached 512.8 million rupiah. After this transaction, Wimpi Salim's ownership in KKGI decreased from 0.02% to 0%.

marketNews.title: Apple Launches iPhone 16 Series Focused on AI, New Watch, and AirPods 4
marketNews.content: Apple (Nasdaq: AAPL) officially launched the iPhone 16 series focusing on artificial intelligence (AI), the latest Apple Watch, and AirPods 4 on Monday (9/9). Additionally, Apple will also release a new AI feature named Apple Intelligence through the iOS 18.1, iPadOS 18.1, and macOS Sequoia 15.1 updates in October 2024.

tickerNews.title: GMFI Plans Rights Issue; GIAA to Inject Rp418.3 Billion in Assets via Inbreng
tickerNews.content: $GMFI: Garuda Maintenance Facility Aero Asia plans to hold a rights issue of up to 11.7 billion new shares with a dilution effect of up to 29.36%. The ratio and exercise price have not yet been announced, while the funds to be obtained are allocated for working capital. GMFI's controller, Garuda Indonesia ($GIAA), will exercise all its rights through inbreng by transferring assets worth a total of 418.3 billion rupiah, consisting of 3 hangar units and their annexes along with supporting facilities at Soekarno-Hatta Airport. [Rencana ini](https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202409/ccc53647f2_88cc45ec8b.pdf) will be discussed in the Extraordinary General Shareholders Meeting (RUPSLB) on October 16, 2024.

tickerNews.title: MIDI's August 2024 SSSG Reaches +12.01% YoY, Opening 111 New Stores in 8M24
tickerNews.content: $MIDI: Midi Utama Indonesia recorded same store sales growth (SSSG) of +12.01% YoY in August 2024 (vs. 1H24: +9.64% YoY), exceeding management's 2024 guidance of +8% YoY. Management of MIDI itself targets SSSG in 3Q24 around +11% YoY. MIDI also reported that the company has opened 36 new Alfamidi outlets in July-August 2024, so the total new outlets in 8M24 reached 111 units or equivalent to 55.5% of the 2024 target of 200 new outlets.

tickerNews.title: DSSA's Geothermal Subsidiary Wins 2 Geothermal Working Area Auctions
tickerNews.content: $DSSA: _[Bisnis](https://epaper.bisnis.com/epaper/detail/page/143718/)_ reported that Dian Swastatika Sentosa's subsidiary in the geothermal sector, PT Daya Anugerah Sejati Utama, has won auctions for 2 geothermal working areas, namely in Cisolok Cisukarame, West Java and Nage, East Nusa Tenggara. Both working areas plan to build geothermal power plants (PLTP) of 40 MW each. However, _Bisnis_ reported that the Ministry of ESDM has not yet been able to announce the auction winners, while DSSA declined to comment on this news.

tickerNews.title: WIKA Repays Rp896 Billion of PUB II Phase I Bonds and Sukuk Principal, Plus Interest
tickerNews.content: $WIKA: Wijaya Karya [announced](https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202409/4dc7d5313c_72432be66b.pdf) that the company has made principal payments for due obligations on its Ongoing Public Offering (PUB) II Phase I Bonds and Sukuk amounting to 896 billion rupiah. The President Director of Wijaya Karya, Agung Budi Waskito, [said](https://market.bisnis.com/read/20240910/192/1798281/wijaya-karya-wika-lunasi-obligasi-dan-sukuk-senilai-rp896-miliar) that this payment is in accordance with the agreement between the company and the bondholders and sukuk holders in the trusteeship. In addition to repaying the principal due, WIKA also paid the interest on the PUB II Phase I Bonds and Sukuk amounting to 55.06 billion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: PORT New Controller Announces Mandatory Tender Offer at Rp818 per Share
tickerNews.content: $PORT: The new controller of Nusantara Pelabuhan Handal, China Merchants International Port-Integrated Development (Hong Kong) Company Limited, [announced](https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202409/a1297557c3_e16670b1c7.pdf) a mandatory tender offer plan for approximately 726 million (25.8%) PORT shares at a price of 818 rupiah per share from September 3 to October 2, 2024. This price is -15.2% lower than PORT's closing price as of Tuesday (10/9). This corporate action was carried out after China Merchants International Port-Integrated Development (Hong Kong) Company Limited [acquired](https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202407/8c3c97470b_613ea94824.pdf) 51% of PORT shares in June 2024.

tickerNews.title: PT Arthakencana Rayatama Increases AKRA Stake to 63.05% After Buying 32.1 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: $AKRA: The controller of AKR Corporindo, PT Arthakencana Rayatama, purchased 32.1 million AKRA shares at an average price of 1,433.9 rupiah per share on September 4-6, 2024. The total transaction value reached 46 billion rupiah. After [this transaction](https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202409/3964a95550_ab6a5392f0.pdf), PT Arthakencana Rayatama's ownership in AKRA increased from 62.89% to 63.05%.

tickerNews.title: BCAP Clarifies Acquisition Offer for Vista Outdoor was Made by Separate Entity
tickerNews.content: $BCAP: MNC Kapital Indonesia denied media reports claiming the company made an offer to acquire Vista Outdoor (NYSE: VSTO). BCAP [explained](https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202409/cbfa19098f_637e8a12da.pdf) that the acquisition offer was made by MNC Capital Partners, L.P., a company based in Montreal, Canada, and is not part of and/or affiliated with the MNC Group.

tickerNews.title: KKGI Director Wimpi Salim Sold 869,099 Shares, Ownership Drops to 0%
tickerNews.content: The Director of Resource Alam Indonesia ($KKGI), Wimpi Salim, sold 869,099 shares of KKGI at an average price of 590 rupiah per share on September 6, 2024. The total transaction value reached 512.8 million rupiah. After [this transaction](https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202409/1563cd347c_17d64446e9.pdf), Wimpi Salim's ownership in KKGI decreased from 0.02% to 0%.
